result.execSummary:
The defendant James T Kimmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court advised the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol, forfeits the release privileges and defendant cannot possess firearms or ammunition.

miscConds.notes:

- No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James T Kimmons

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant.
Letter from defendant requesting payment plan.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $432.00 entered as ordered by the court on10/16/15 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 08/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Decision and Order Denying Request to Modify Probation Term received and filed.  Copies mailed to attorneys./ds
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. mag
Defendant's request to modify his probation term to accommodate his need to travel for work.

Defendant James T Kimmons in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 04.  Sentencing proceeds.   State advises the Court they have complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 90 days at the House of Correction with Huber for work.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments, DV surcharge and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) anger management; 4) no contact with victim without the approval of the Court; 5) no contact with firearms; 6) pay supervision fees or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant. 

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges and defendant cannot possess firearms or ammunition.

COURT ORDERS:
- restitution set at -0-.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Memorandum of Conditions of Probation received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Court does not set a review date.  If necessary, the agent can bring the case back into Court.
Due to branch 4 in trial, case transferred for Sentencing Hearing before branch 44.   mld

Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.    Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 4. Court ordered the Defendant not to be in possession of any firearms or weapons; and to follow all conditions of bail, which include no contact with the victim Katie D.  COURT VACATED JURY TRIAL set for 06-24-2015.

Defendant James T Kimmons in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State Court ordered Count 1 AMENDED from Battery  TO Disorderly Conduct under Wisconsin Stats. 947.01(1) and 973.055(1). Parties are prepared to proceed with a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James T Kimmons in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  911 tape will be forwarded to defense counsel, per the State.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 6-24-2014 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Katie D., and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld
signed and filed.   mld

Defendant James T Kimmons in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda (as a friend of the court).  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case recalled.  Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Upon questioning, Court appoints Attorney Eduardo Borda, who was present and agreed to accept case.  Court orders Attorney Borda to be paid at the rate of $60 per hour.  Defendant will repay the County at the rate of $60.00 per month commencing upon the conclusion of case.   Discovery received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-19-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Katie D., and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant James T Kimmons in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Case passed.     mld

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (02-18-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Katie D.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant James T Kimmons in court.  Ann R. Lpez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 04.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
